instructions: **Version:** 1.2.8This character sheet was originally made for **Maschinenleben** (released later this year), a fan product for the **Savage Worlds Adventure Edition** (SWADE) about cyborgs struggling with their loss of self. Due to its extensive build and customization options, it may be used for many other settings as well.**Make sure to read the Help section in the Settings tab!**#### Notable Features* **Blocks:** Allies, Augmentations, Integrity/Sanity, Powers, Vehicles, and more* **Fields On Demand:** Show only what you really need to keep the view tidy* **Customization:** Optional rules and functions, custom skills, and renaming* **Rolls:** Multiple dice for multiple targets (RoF 1-8) with a custom Wild Die* **Failures/Botches:** Dice that show a [1] or [2] are colored red or gray* **Health/Conditions:** Manage Wounds, Fatigue, and more with a simple click* **Silhouettes:** They look fancy! You can also add color markers as indicators* **Extra Sheet:** Alternative sheet with a simplified layout for NPCs#### Notes* Boost performance by disabling style features* Requires a mouse to fully operate (hover); poor touch support* Some attributes have to be translated (renamed) manually* Join the [support game](https://app.roll20.net/join/8488284/oQJGfg) for bug reports and requests---You can support development of this sheet by contributing to the [Ko-fi](https://ko-fi.com/tetrakern) of the author. This [Ko-fi](https://ko-fi.com/tetrakern) is not affiliated with Roll20; as such, contributions are voluntary and Roll20 cannot provide support or refunds for contributions.---#### Latest Changes##### Version 1.2.8* Improved container width adaption for Edges/Hindrances* Improved container height adaption for Abilities* Added container height adaption to Quick Notes* Added new Custom Skills to Game Settings##### Version 1.2.7* Added visibility toggles for Apparel, Quick Notes, and Weapons blocks* Added option to rename Apparel and Weapons blocks within the sheet* Added option to rename non-default skills within the sheet* Added four more custom skills for a total of six* Fixed incorrect unskilled modifier in track-rolls on the Extra Sheet* Fixed custom button roll templates missing control attributes##### Version 1.2.6* Improved roll macros* Improved dice codes in Roll Templates* Fixed Soak button using outdated macro* Added width constrains to translatable elements* Added setting toggle to reduce untrained skill penalty* Minor style improvements##### Version 1.2.5* Refactored all skill rolls* Extended [Button] option in lists with a modifier field* Added [Ace Damage] toggle to Engrams, Powers, and Weapons* Added helper button to toggle global GM rolls* Added Abilities block##### Version 1.2.4* Added three configurable custom buttons to Settings > Setup##### Version 1.2.3* Added helper button to toggle global Wild Die query* Added helper button to toggle global Rate of Fire query* Added helper button to toggle global Bonus Wild Die query---

useroptions.description: Use the No Power Points Setting Rule (SWADE 140).
Use the Strain rules from the Science Fiction Companion (SFC 29).
Makes the run die Ace.
Wound penalties are not subtracted from the run roll.

Fatigue penalties are subtracted from the run roll.

Show/Hide Blocks

You can show or hide content blocks in accordance with the played Game Setting. This can also be done manually for each individual sheet in its Settings tab. Some blocks that were designed for Maschinenleben, such as Augmentations and Engrams, can be adapted for other purposes as well.
List special abilities or monstrous powers.
Keep track of allied characters with a barebone mini sheet.
Keep track of your loaded ammunition for three weapons.
Install augmentations/cyberware and keep track of the Loss/Strain.
Special programs or hardware to execute Hacking actions.
Quantifies mental health/sanity and keeps track of mental afflictions. Maschinenleben.
The energy/mana/etc. reserves of a character.
The known powers/spells of a character.
Vehicles and their modifications/weapons.
Vehicles and their modifications/weapons.

Walkers/Mechs and their modifications/weapons.

Show/Hide Skills

You can show or hide skills from the list in accordance with the played Game Setting. This can also be done manually for each individual sheet in its Settings tab. There are two custom skills that can be renamed and modified within the sheet as well, for example to make specialized skills (e.g. specific weapons with custom bonus or Wild Die).
Show the Boating (Agility) skill.
Show the Driving (Agility) skill.
Show the Electronics (Smarts) skill.
Show the Faith (Spirit) skill.
Show the Focus (Spirit) skill.
Show the Language (Smarts) skill.
Show the MAGIC (Smarts) skill. Maschinenleben.
Show the Occult (Smarts) skill.
Show the Piloting (Agility) skill.
Show the Psionics (Smarts) skill.
Show the Riding (Agility) skill.
Show the Spellcasting (Smarts) skill.
Show the Weird Science (Smarts) skill.

Rename Attributes

You can rename the labels of each attribute and its abbreviation (max. 3 characters). This can also be done manually with the @{rename-attribute} for each individual sheet. Note that changing the label does not affect the reference @{attribute} for rolls. They will always be in English.
Renamed via the attribute rename_agility.
Renamed via the attribute rename_agi.
Renamed via the attribute rename_smarts.
Renamed via the attribute rename_sma.
Renamed via the attribute rename_spirit.
Renamed via the attribute rename_spi.
Renamed via the attribute rename_strength.
Renamed via the attribute rename_str.
Renamed via the attribute rename_vigor.

Renamed via the attribute rename_vig.

Rename Skills

You can rename the labels of each skill, best kept below 15 characters due to layout constrains. This can also be done manually with the @{rename-attribute} for each individual sheet. Note that changing the label does not affect the reference @{attribute} for rolls. They will always be in English.
Renamed via the attribute rename_academics.
Renamed via the attribute rename_athletics.
Renamed via the attribute rename_boating.
Renamed via the attribute rename_common_knowledge.
Renamed via the attribute rename_driving.
Renamed via the attribute rename_electronics.
Renamed via the attribute rename_faith.
Renamed via the attribute rename_fighting.
Renamed via the attribute rename_focus.
Renamed via the attribute rename_gambling.
Renamed via the attribute rename_hacking.

Renamed via the attribute rename_language.

Renamed via the attribute rename_custom_skill_# (replace # with number).

Rename Labels

You can rename the labels at the top of the sheet, such as "Name" to "Alias" or "Origin" to "Race". This can also be done manually with the @{rename-label-attribute} for each individual sheet. Note that the labels are separated from the actual fields and do not affect the references (e.g. @{name}). They will always be in English.
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_name (e.g. Alias or Codename).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_origin (e.g. Race or Species).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_rank (e.g. Grade or Titel).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_level (e.g. Circle or Year).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_exp (e.g. Karma or Gems).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_gender (e.g. Sex or Version).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_age (e.g. Number or Incarnation).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_hair (e.g. Horns or Mane).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_eyes (e.g. Sensors or Optics).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_height (e.g. Scale or Length).
Renamed via the attribute rename_label_weight (e.g. Mass or Your Mom).

Renamed via the attribute rename_label_bits (e.g. Money or Gold).

Rename Blocks

You can rename the blocks to better fit the Game Setting, such as "Powers" to "Talismans" or "Walkers" to "Frames". This can also be done manually with the @{rename-block-attribute} for each individual sheet.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_allies.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_apparel.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_ammunition.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_augmentations.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_engrams.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_integrity.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_inventory.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_power.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_powers.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_powerarmors.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_quick_notes.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_vehicles.
Renamed via the attribute rename_block_walkers.

Renamed via the attribute rename_block_weapons.

Rename Integrity Hindrances (Maschinenleben)

You can rename the Hindrances caused by the loss of Integrity (Sanity, Purity, etc.). This can also be done manually with the @{rename_integrity_attribute} for each individual sheet. Note that they activate in intervals for each fraction of 10 below 70 Discord triggers on 69.9 or lower, Dissonance on 59.9 or lower, and so forth.
Renamed via the attribute rename_discord.
Renamed via the attribute rename_psychosis.
Renamed via the attribute rename_seizures.
Renamed via the attribute rename_depersonalization.
Renamed via the attribute rename_dissonance.
Renamed via the attribute rename_alienation.
Renamed via the attribute rename_derealization.
Renamed via the attribute rename_ego_death.
